Dear Ms. Lanning:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
November 30, 2021. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) This facility is non-contracted therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable
3.) The facility is not a local MDHHS office nor does the facility have a MDHHS
contract, therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care, substantiated
child abuse and/or neglect, or substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has not submitted any corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reports the agency has continued to maintain the same
process as the previous review period and she feels as though they have been
successful. The agency has plans to enhance the current processes in place. The
Chief Administrator did not report experiencing any challenges or barriers to achieve
compliance. The CA assessment reports the agency was not under a Corrective
Action Plan the previous review period.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff via phone. Staff acknowledged that
COVID-19 created some challenges regarding interviewing applicants. Overall, staff
reported things have gone well during the past review period. There are regular
team meetings as well as regular meetings with supervision. Staff did not report any
concerns or areas of need.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
